H0.text: Algae are the organisms that often grow excessively due to the added nutrients from fertilizer.

H1.text: Mushrooms are the organism that often grows excessively due to added nutrients from fertilizer.

H2.text: Sediments are the organism that often experiences excessive growth due to the added nutrients from fertilizer.

H3.text: Crustaceans are the organism whose excessive growth is often caused by the added nutrients from fertilizer.

A4.text: Algal blooms are the result of a nutrient, like nitrogen or phosphorus from various sources (for example fertilizer runoff or other forms of nutrient pollution), entering the aquatic system and causing excessive growth of algae.
